thread.title: ISRO sets record after launching 104 satellites and Twitterati loses its calm
thread.title_full: ISRO sets record after launching 104 satellites and Twitterati loses its calm

title: ISRO sets record after launching 104 satellites and Twitterati loses its calm

organizations.name: indian express online media pvt ltd

text:
— The Viral Fever (@TheViralFever) February 15, 2017 #ISRO launches 104 satellites in one go. It is still less than the number of launches made by Congress for Rahul Gandhi. 
— Chicken Biryanii (@ChickenBiryanii) February 15, 2017 This is the seating diagram of an Indian Railways non-AC chair car. Congrats ISRO on transporting even more satellites in a single rocket. pic.twitter.com/8a2TY48ov0 
— Ramesh Srivats (@rameshsrivats) February 15, 2017 Ravi Shastri: That went like a rocket! http://t.co/Jkf9rt9UD7 
ALSO READ | Twitterati come up with hilarious captions for photo showing Ivanka Trump looking fondly at Justin Trudeau 
Just like in 2016, ISRO used the popular Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) as its carrier this time as well while making Indians proud. With this, India has broken the record set by Russia, which in 2014 launched 37 satellites together in a single mission. Prime Minister Modi called this an “exceptional achievement” and congratulated the entire team of scientists and the Secretary of the Department of Space. He went on to tweet that this record was a “proud moment for our space scientific community and the nation”. © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
